definition: to obey/to follow/to arrange/to make reasonable/along/favorable

sentences.english: I hope everything is going well and you are enjoying your life there in Australia.
sentences.chinese: 我希望你一切安好，在澳大利亚的生活也都顺心如意。

sentences.english: I can tell that your tired of being lonley.
sentences.chinese: 因为我能让事事顺心直到清晨。

sentences.english: I always congratulate friends when something goes their way.
sentences.chinese: 每逢我的朋友事事顺心的时候我总是祝贺他们。

sentences.english: But almost cold, saying, even so, she will at least one line up.
sentences.chinese: 顺心却冰冷的说，就算这样，起码她将朵索养大了。

sentences.english: I've been fortunate this year to get most things my way.
sentences.chinese: 今年我很幸运，大多数事情都做得顺心如意。

sentences.english: Indeed, anything untoward was now kept from James.
sentences.chinese: 的确，现在一切不顺心的事都小心瞒著詹姆士。

sentences.english: I'm feeling rather frustrated in my present job; I need a change.
sentences.chinese: 我感到现在做得很不顺心，需要换一换工作。

sentences.english: In fact, when things go your way, you should be modest rather than pompous.
sentences.chinese: 事实上，一切顺心如意时，你应谦虚而非自大。

sentences.english: Call up momma when all else fails?
sentences.chinese: 当一切不顺心时你会打电话给妈妈吗？

sentences.english: And Brooklyn, especially, it was just a smaller environment where I was able to  flourish
sentences.chinese: 尤其是在规模较小的布鲁克林，我感到事事顺心。

sentences.english: Emotive fails, of the job not satisfactory.
sentences.chinese: 感情的失败，工作的不顺心。

sentences.english: I’ve been fortunate this year to get most things my way.
sentences.chinese: 今年我很幸运，大多数事情都做得顺心如意。

sentences.english: As usual when things weren't going her way, Mary turned quite sulky.
sentences.chinese: 像往常一样，事情一不顺心，玛丽就会郁郁不乐。

sentences.english: Her mother knew that things were not going well at school.
sentences.chinese: 她的母亲知道肯定是在学校里碰到不顺心的事了。

sentences.english: Under the satisfactory arrogant attitude, wanted to Sue for a tough ode to line out.
sentences.chinese: 在顺心嚣张的态度下，苏切本想让颂强硬将朵索抱走。

definition: everything is going smoothly/just as one wishes
as one wants/according to one's wishes/ruyi scepter, a symbol of power and good fortune
after one's heart (idiom); gratifying and satisfactory/everything one could wish
propitious wind throughout the journey (idiom)/plain sailing/to go smoothly/have a nice trip!
to have one's wishes come true/wish you the best!
to obey/to follow/to arrange/to make reasonable/along/favorable
